Base:Descriptions.Base:Description:
This portrait has been carefully placed in an ornate tulipwood frame. Bouncy pale-blonde hair frames the face of the lop-eared bunny within. The locks fall in front of her collarbone and flow behind her shoulders in loose waves but cannot obscure the subject's ears. Her right ear bears a colorful tattoo -- a medium-sized blue and white variegated butterfly is suspended in mid-flight. A thin, gossamer-like trail of silver dust has been intricately inked to flow whimsically behind it. The tattoo is partially hidden in shadow. The bunny's large brown eyes are shifted to the left and set above a small, flat nose. Her tiny mouth rests beneath that, and her full lips are curled into a smile that suggests (with the help of the subject's posture) genuine sincerity and endearing shyness.
A pink blush gently graces her cheeks.
The woman is wearing a modest gown whose color -- the blue of a midnight sky -- contrasts eye-catchingly with her fuzzy strawberry blonde fur. The collar falls down into a slight dip, falling low enough to reveal the collarbone upon which the lop's hair ends. Long bell sleeves fall to either side, cut from a separate fabric and attached from the top of the shoulders, falling down to the bottom of the canvas. A decorative lace lining covers the seams that connects the sleeves to the body of the dress. The strokes of the author's brush are mostly visible, but provide a uniform direction for the eye to flow and give the dress a soft texture.
The background is a dark green curtain muted almost entirely by a dark shadow. Gentle folds and wrinkles curl down it, and care has been put into making the background interesting but not distracting.
The signature of Henry hides among a gathering of cloth in the curtain.

Core:Properties.Core:Property: "An abstract painting of black and white stripes with a splatter of red along the right side. This painting is done in oil paints."
